title: Stop saying that these champions are unoriginal and plain copies of other champs.
body:

I think you're missing the point. What I've seen most people complain about isn't her gameplay, but her overall design and thematic. 

She uses the same design the rest of the Enchanters use, flowy, light, pastels, feminine. The only thing that makes her stand out from a thematic point of view is that she's a cat.
That's fair I guess. I've heard talk of a "Drill Sergent" support for awhile, and that would be a much bigger thematic break from what they have done in the past.
Tbh they tried bringing something new to supports with Pyke and almost everybody hates him. :shrug: (I mean playing against and sometimes even with him. Not that people hate to play him.)
They hate him because he has way more potential to kill you then normal supports. Not because he's a deviation from normal support thematic design.

I'll never understand people who cry about champions being copies of each other
They do realize that almost all champions copy each other's auto attacks, right?
No because Jinx uses a gun and Draven uses a sword and Lucian uses a g- oh

But when Riot does create an original champion that is not a copy paste champion, everyone loses their mind saying shit like "breaking the absolute rules of the game".

https://media.giphy.com/media/AVpE6BqnOvbzi/giphy.gif
Yea the problem is that Riot only does that with Assassin and Fighters and Bruisers.  You will never see a support impact the game in the same way that a Yasuo or Akali does.

Isnt overloaded? That is yet to be seen. All we know is her abilities and we have a trailer. From trailers you can't assume anything. For example, Did we know that zoe would have been a 1 shooting piece of shit from the trailer? No, so, we don't know

And I don't really see why people are saying that these abilities are so so similar. 

Yuumi's ult is nothing like Sona's ult. Sona's is an AoE stun. One shot. Yuumi's ult is wider, and continues to pulse in the direction she cast it in. It's a root, not a stun. 

Rakan's E shields his teammate each time he casts it, and he has other positioning-based abilities that allow him to be crazy mobile with it. Yuumi doesn't shield her ally with her W, and she just kind of glues herself to them. This is one of the most unique parts of her kit. 

Her Q being able to be guided by your mouse is a completely new mechanic to League that only works because she doesn't need to use her mouse to move. 

Her heal is just Kayle's heal, I can't really defend this one. It might be a burst of decaying movespeed and the numbers might be different, but it's a heal+speed boost for her or a teammate. Not much else to say. 

Yuumi has one of the most mechanically unique kits in the game. Functionally, she's similar to many other enchanters, but she does it like no other champion.

>Yuumi's ult is nothing like Sona's ult. Sona's is an AoE stun. One shot. Yuumi's ult is wider, and continues to pulse in the direction she cast it in. It's a root, not a stun.

Its what Neeko's ult is to Nunu's. Yuumi's ult is the delayed mobile form of Sona's ult

>Yuumi doesn't shield her ally with her W, and she just kind of glues herself to them. This is one of the most unique parts of her kit.

Her passive provides the shield when attached. In fact she provides bonus AD, movement speed, healing, and shields while attached (Depending on whether the wording "until it breaks" is literal or not).

Not to mention her Zoe-like Q (Except controllable with mouse) can also be launched while attached.

>Her Q being able to be guided by your mouse is a completely new mechanic to League that only works because she doesn't need to use her mouse to move.

Depending on the range (Which can be assumed to be decent to long as damage increases with distance) this will be problematic because a mouse can move more easily than a dodging champion in terms of readjusting flight paths.

---

Don't get me wrong, I am excited to see a Jhin + Full AP Yuumi bot lane.

Like, Imagine Nasus with an undying support being with him

Hell, someone out there may even make duo jungle viable with laners strong at 1v2 to cover for bot lane
You're right, Yuumi isn't a Sona clone. She's an upgrade lulu that's stuck at bot lane forever.
Clones is an offensive term. Please use the politically correct "Echo Fighters" instead.

If originality were an issue, then there would only be 1 champion for each class.
The same thing happened with Jhin, the same thing happened with Sylas, and we're gonna keep seeing the same thing.

The main point everybody is supposed to know is that a game like League, you can't expect to make champions so unique with literally nothing in common. 140+ champions, let's assume each with 5 unique abilities (passive + QWER), that's 700+ abilities Riot has to make different from the other and for such a number in order to be so unique is just impossible. It'll require a miracle to even reach like 100 to begin with.

And the fact there are actually people who think like all "oh you copy bla bla bla!" is so delusional that they probably shouldn't even play League.

What a champions requires to become unique is just that 1 element that will make the champion original.

You want unoriginal shit where your complaint is actually valid? Looks at mobile legends. Look at that shit.

I totally agree with you, as a Blitz main. I love Thresh because even if he misses his hook, he still  has his W and E to help his allies or push the enemies away. And his R is great both for engaging and saving your buddies (especially combined with Zeke). Blitz, on the other hand, is way more aggressive: you cannot fail your hook, otherwise you can just try and escape or hope that muting your opponents with your R will be enough. Actually, his whole kit is centered around his Q: W to run towards them, E to stun them after landing your hook, R to finish them off if need arises. I prefer Blitz and I actually believe they're quite different champions, but if I had to say who's harder to master, then it's definitely Blitzcrank.
